Yes, ethical sourcing and responsible investing are increasingly important to consumers and stakeholders, with the growing awareness of the social and environmental impact of business operations. Companies that prioritize ethical sourcing and sustainability are more likely to win the trust of their stakeholders and build a strong reputation over time.

Aviva is one of the companies that has recognized this trend and has taken steps to integrate ethical and sustainable practices throughout its business operations. By doing so, the company can build a strong relationship with customers, employees, suppliers, and the broader community, while also contributing to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals, which seeks to promote prosperity while protecting the planet.
